paper-presentation.tagline: Beauty of expression is so akin to the voice of sea
paper-presentation.description:
“Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you have got to say and say it HOT” - D.H.Lawrence
If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way. Take advantage of presenting your paper/research on-site to a panel of fellow researchers and academicians in the field of education.
paper-presentation.general_rules:
Submit your papers by September 1,2019 at cse.innovativemind@gmail.com
Mention the Name,Institute,Branch,Year,Contact Number,Email ID for each author of the paper.
Manuscript in IEEE format ,as .pdf/.doc/.docx
Paper must not have been presented or published anywhere before,or be under consideration for publication any conference or journal.
Maximum of 3 student authors are allowed.
Participants in a team can be from same/different institutes.
A big NO to plagiarism please.
rounds:
Prelims - The received entries from participants will be evaluated based on the following several criteria such as innovation, scope, plagiarism, the format of the paper, etc. Those who are shortlisted will receive an email from the organizing team by September 3, 2019.

 The shortlisted participants will be able to attend the Paper Presentation event to be held on September 6, 2019. They must carry the following:
•	Identity Card of each participant in a team
•	Hard copies of their paper – 2 numbers
•	Powerpoint of their presentation
Each team will be judged by a panel of experienced academicians and researchers. The decision of the panel is final. 

Prizes worth 7.5k awaits.

techathlon.description: It's that time of the year, where we use our technical skills to have some fun. Algorithms, Networks , OS and 5 other domains where you can get your hands dirty. Let's Techathlon!
rounds: Participants must choose 3 domains out of available 8. Each domain will have a question set with 20 MCQs.
The Qualified Teams will choose one set from the available sets. Each set will have two coding questions from 2 different domains. The participants are required to solve them in the given time.

code-inverse.tagline: Shift your Coding gear to reverse!
code-inverse.description: Excited about Code Inverse? Experience the multiverse of madness of programming.
rounds:
This will be a pen and paper based round.
Questions covering basic C and C++ concepts will be given.
Number of Questions: 20.
Duration : 30 minutes.
Top 6 teams from the first round will be selected for the second round.

Computer based coding round.
C and C++ can be used.
Each team will have to solve 3 programming questions.
A mix of reverse coding and blind coding event.
Teams that are fast and efficient will be the winners of the day!

meme-time.description: It’s Meme Time this invente season. Memes have become an integral part of life since the advent of social media. They have played a significant role in creating strong opinions among people in various domains like politics, culture etc. We at SSN, recognize the power of memes in communicating messages to people all around the world. Come and make us laugh and think with innovative and fulfilled memes. Keep calm and meme on.Original, unpublished memes only will be awarded.
meme-time.general_rules:
1. Maximum 2 in a team.
2. We will provide a PC and Wi-Fi. Bring Templates and Video Editing tools(if needed).
rounds:
1. Type of test - Meme posters (First Round)
2. Time to arrive at the venue - 10.30 AM (for registration)
3. Qualification to next round - creative and humorous Meme posters
4. Topics will be given on the spot
5. Duration - 30 minutes
6. Disqualification criteria - Gender degrading, Politics and Religion related memes will be disqualified
7. Judging criteria - original,unpublished memes only eligible

1. Type of test - Meme Videos (Second Round)
2. Topics will be given on the spot
3. Duration - 45 minutes
4. Disqualification criteria - Gender degrading, Politics and Religion related memes will be disqualified
5. Video time (maximum 3 minutes)
6. Judging criteria - original,unpublished memes only eligible

yesqueueluck.description: The Most Simplest yet Fruitful of all the events is back for it's 2nd venture. Colossal Rewards are @ Stake. No Worries, Just Queries!
rounds:
Paper and Pen Test
-> 30 MCQs with Marks of Difficulty differing for each question. No negative marks.
-> Time : 60 Minutes
-> Shortlisted Teams will move to the next round.
-> Maximum 10-15 Teams will be selected based on the Marks they score.

Online Test
-> 10 Questions with 10 marks each. Participants must write queries for the given problem statements.
-> Partial Marks will be given.
-> Time : 75 Minutes
-> Top 3 Teams will get Rewards worth 6.5K

sci-tech-quiz.tagline: General Quiz with a Sci-Tech flavour
sci-tech-quiz.description: Get your minds whirring and your pounce sheets ready, and gear up for the third annual Inventé CSE quiz! This is a general quiz with a hint of SciTech, so whether you're someone who lives, eats and breathes computer-science or you're someone who's just learning about binary, the Sci-Tech quiz has something for everyone!
sci-tech-quiz.general_rules:
1. Maximum team size of 2, Lonewolf is allowed
2. Registration Fees for a team- ₹50
rounds:
1) Two rounds- a prelims and a finals
2) Prelims will be written
3) The first round will start at 9.30 AM sharp
4) Prelims will not have any negative marking
5) Usage of the internet will lead to instant disqualification

1) Six teams in the finals
2) The format followed will be Pounce and Bounce
3) The finals will have four rounds
4) Usage of the internet will lead to instant disqualification

u-n-i.description: Are you passionate about UI designing? Do you love bringing your designs to life? Then U ‘n’ I is ready to challenge your creativity! This event is one of a kind and all you need to win is the love to think, design and create. Well, what are you waiting for? Get, set, design!
rounds:
1)	A number of exciting and creative app scenarios will be presented from 
        which participants can choose one.
2)	For the app scenario of their choice, participants should design the 
        following two pages :
•	Home page of the app [Mandatory]
•	Any other page that brings out a feature of the app [Example.: Chat page, 
        News feed, Profile page, etc]
3)	Participants can use only the following software for design:
•	Adobe Illustrator 
•	Adobe Photoshop
4)	Computers with the above mentioned software will be provided at the 
        venue.
5)    Time provided: 3 hours

codolympics.description:
Do you speak in Parser tongue? Do you Map Reduce sheep while you sleep? Does O3 optimised code get your adrenaline pumping? If you have answered YES to any of these questions then you have to come to the right place!.

Welcome to Codolympics, the flagship event of the CSE department. Prove yourself to be the best coder and take home an opportunity to intern at MOTORQ with a stipend of 1.2 Lakhs.
rounds:
Duration: 45 mins
Pen and Paper round

Duration: 1 hour
On-site Programming round in Hackerrank

Duration: 2.5 hours
On-site programming round in Codechef

code-relay.tagline: Life is a race, Run & Run
code-relay.description: Run for your life, Run because you can run, Relay for Life: Code like there's no tomorrow. Race to your ability. Dream big. Hope big. Relay big. Try something more humorous! Have you ever faced difficulty with debugging, version control and consistency in code? Come relay your work with the team and win exciting prizes.
code-relay.general_rules: Participants must come in teams of three.
rounds: This round is a Pen and Paper Test consisting of 60 Technical Aptitude MCQs to be answered in 45 minutes. There will be 10 *(marked) questions. Answering those questions correctly could increase the probability of getting shortlisted for the next round accordingly.

This round is a 1-hour online HackerRank Coding challenge where each group will be given 3 different program questions and each member will start working on one program. After every 20 minutes, programs are interchanged within the group members. The challenge involves basic Data Structures and Alogrithms questions. Teams with better quality code and better compilation time could win Prizes worth upto Rs. 6.5k.

hackers-asylum.tagline: Call yourself a hacker ??  come let’s see what you’ve got !!
hackers-asylum.description: To hack is human, but to do so ethically is divine! To all those who are more than intrigued by the white mask, fret not, because we're here to present you the best way to get about it. All you've to do is register, pack up your thinking hats and be here.
hackers-asylum.general_rules:
1) Can partispate as a team of 2. Lone wolfs are also welcome. 
2) There are no other rules , you are allowed to use internet or any other reference throughout the event.
rounds: Objective based pen and paper test. The primary topics are going to be networking, forensics, Linux, steganography etc. from security perspective. You will be given with 30 mins of time at this round. You can feel free to use internet at this round.

This is going to be a Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge, in which all the teams will be given with a multi stage digital puzzle to solve. This round would last upto 3 hrs. Each team will be assigned with 2 systems, one with internet connection can use it to refer any online resource to solve our challenge.

code-obfuscation-reverse-coding.tagline: “Making complex things simple is more complex than making simple things complex”
code-obfuscation-reverse-coding.description:
Are you someone who is enthusiastic about coding, but at the same time can read in between the lines and identify the essential alone?
Then this is the right place for you! Come join us and have fun in obfuscating and deobfuscating  problems and be the winner.
code-obfuscation-reverse-coding.general_rules: 1. Each team can contain a maximum of 2 members
rounds: A pen-paper round consisting of 15 MCQs and deobfuscation of 2 problems
Obfuscate, Deobfuscate and solve Reverse Coding problems

appology.tagline: No Mobile is Smart without Applications
appology.description:
Are you a freak in developing creative , sublime applications in android /iOS. 
Showcase your skills in developing ,integrating out of box designs for on spot use cases in the event.
appology.general_rules:
1. Teams of 3-5 max
2. Students will be provided with on spot use cases.
3. Create apps for android / iOS with attractive design and agile functionalities.
4. Students should bring their own laptop with all development software installed.
rounds: No Mobile Phones and gadgets allowed

1. Teams of 3-5 max
2. Students will be provided with on spot use cases.
3. Create apps for android / iOS with attractive design and agile functionalities.
4. Students should bring their own laptop with all development software installed.

paper-presentation.description: Are you a group of budding innovators who come up with creative ideas but not provided with a platform to showcase your ideas ? Join us in presenting your ideas at Paper Presentation and getting your ideas recognised which paves  way  for creating a better tomorrow.
paper-presentation.general_rules:
Present your ideas on the topics -
Quantum computing 
AR/VR 
Cyber Security/Information Security
5G Technology
Artificial Neural Networks
Fog Computing 
Blockchain
Augmented Analytics
Blue Brain Technology
Big Data
AI & ML
Business Intelligence
Speech & Image Processing
Ambient Intelligence 
And topics relevant to Information Technology
rounds:
Present your ideas on the topics -
Quantum computing 
AR/VR 
Cyber Security/Information Security
5G Technology
Artificial Neural Networks
Fog Computing 
Blockchain
Augmented Analytics
Blue Brain Technology
Big Data
AI & ML
Business Intelligence
Speech & Image Processing
Ambient Intelligence 
And topics relevant to Information Technology

hired-or-not-hired.tagline: As real a fake interview could be
hired-or-not-hired.description:
Have a job interview coming up ? Doing a trial run can give you the preparation you need to nail the real thing .
Practice your answers in a mock interview.
hired-or-not-hired.general_rules:
1.Individual  contest.
2.Electronic Gadgets  are not allowed.
3.Hard copy of a  resume is required for final round.
rounds: Will be a pen and paper round,  comprises of 20 MCQs (Quantitative Aptitude, Programming Logic).
Comprises of one coding question (can use any platform).
Technical interview for the short listed candidates.

call-of-duty.tagline: "Better to fight for something than live for nothing." --General George S. Patton, Call of Duty
call-of-duty.description: The PUBG of our times, Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare is more than a game and  one that deserves to be reminisced for ages. What sounds better than getting the opportunity to play the game we cherish in addition to competing and winning exciting cash prizes? It cannot get better! Play, Compete, Win.
call-of-duty.general_rules:
1. Each team should contain 4 members
2. Registration Rs.200 per team
3. Players may bring their own headphones and mousepads, but keyboards and mice are prohibited
rounds:
1. The first match will be a team deathmatch between two teams and the timing will be 10 minutes.
2. The teams will be filtered according to the highest point basis i.e., the 4 teams which scored the highest score in deathmatch will move forward for the next round.
1. The 4 teams will clash with any other team in a sabotage match for 2 points i.e., the team which scores 2 points in the sabotage match wins (the timing will be 10 minutes)

The final round will also be a sabotage match with 10 min timing and the first
team which scores 2 points win.

fifa-19.description: How good does it feel to score a screamer with Ronaldo or to dribble past the greatest defenders with Messi? Have you got it to become the Champion? FIFA and Chill!
fifa-19.general_rules:
1. Keyboards will be available. Players are strongly advised to bring their own joysticks
2. Only default gameplay settings are allowed
3. Only tactical defending is allowed.
4. Registration fee - Rs.60 per head
rounds:
1. A player will clash with any other available random player (not with the
computer)
2. Halftime duration - 4 minutes
3. Successive rounds will be based on knockout basis
4. Organizers reserve the right to modify the rules at any time

smackdown.displayName: WWE SmackDown! Here Comes the Pain
smackdown.tagline: The game that defined our childhood
smackdown.description: Brock Lesnar's F5, Stone Cold Steve Austin's Stunner, Goldberg's Spear, The Undertaker's Tombstone Piledriver, Triple H's Pedigree, Shawn Michaels's Sweet Chin Music - if all these made you take a trip down your memory lane, then you would not want to miss this. Play "WWE SmackDown! Here comes the Pain" and win exciting cash prizes.
smackdown.general_rules:
1. Players are strongly advised to bring their own PS2 joysticks
2. Registration fee - Rs.60 per head
3. Organizers reserve the right to modify the rules at any time.
4. There may be one or more rounds in between round 1 and final round.
rounds:
Each player will be put in the ring alongside 5-7 players and the top two will
qualify to the next round

Final round
Qualified players from round 1 will clash against each other and the winner will
be decided

cup-of-code.description:
Heyy! Are you good at data structures and algorithms? Do you think that you can do a problem in O(1)? And most importantly can you code in a lightening speed? Then sharpen your mind to crack SSN's CUP OF CODE! Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Only good programmers write code that humans can understand. So get ready to express your logics through Code!
Come and grab a cup of coffee and win the Cup of Code !
cup-of-code.general_rules:
1. Maximum of 2 members in a team.
2. No tab switching is allowed.
3. Use of electronic gadgets such as mobile phones, tablets, pendrives,etc…are not allowed.
rounds:
1. Pen and paper MCQ round(Programming logic)
2. 30 MCQs in 30 mins.

1. Data structures and algorithm contest in
an online Judge(Hacker Rank )
2. 90 minutes round with 3 programming
questions.

webfx.tagline: If you think math is hard, try Web Design!
webfx.description: Think you have what it takes to make a website that can do wonders? Then register for one of the biggest contests from our IT extravaganza "WebFX "! Challenge yourself with the finest developers from all around and have the chance to not only gain skill from this fruitful experience but also win exciting cash prizes and get hired by astounding tech companies!
webfx.general_rules:
1. 3 per Team.
2. Participants should not use mobile phones during the first round. 
3. 2 computers will be provided for the entire team for the second round. 
4. 10 mins will be given for each finalist to explain their product. 
5. Decisions of the Event Heads are final and should be respected.
rounds:
1. Paper Pen Round consisting of 20 MCQs and 5 Subjective Questions about Web Technologies. 
2. Each team be given 1 hour for the same.

1. Top 5 teams will be selected for Development round which demands a web app where each team should choose 1 topic of the three given topics on spot.
2.  3 hours will be given to each team and 10 mins to explain their product.

cryptit.tagline: Speak in code’feel free to decipher
cryptit.description: Are you someone who is interested in cracking the code and finding things?! Then this is the right place for you...prepare yourself to think the unthinkable, do the undoable and prepare to grapple with ineffable itself at cryptIT
cryptit.general_rules:
1. Single entry only.
2. Participants shall not be allowed to use mobile or any other electronic instruments.
3. Maximum allotted time is 20 minutes
4. 10-15 members will be selected for the next round.
rounds:
1. Pen and paper round where participants must solve the maximum possible questions in permitted time.
2. Selected participants are called for the further round.

1. All the participants shortlisted from the previous round will have to decipher a set of encrypted cipher strings and write a program to perform the same. 
2. Winner will be judged based on their accuracy.

data-request.description: "In Data We Trust" Do you believe that data could speak to you? Do you think that there's something that the data knows,which you don't? Is the answer to the universe actually 42? Come join us in the quest to find out whether you can predict the future while you unravel the secrets that the data holds using the art of Data Analytics!
data-request.general_rules:
1. 1-2 per Team.
2. Participants should bring laptops with the preferred tool installed
(if possible) for the second round. Else intimate us a week before
about the tool required.
3. Decisions of the event organizers are final and should be respected.
rounds:
Round 1 (CHOICEMAKER):
This round will consist of MCQs which will be based on statistics,
probability and basic techniques related to analytics.

Round 2 (HULK SMASH OF DATA):
A dataset will be provided to the participants and they are required
to perform a basic analysis of the data. The final output should be close to
the expected result.

data-analytics-workshop.displayName: Who wants to be a data scientist
data-analytics-workshop.tagline: A Comprehensive guideline to the hottest job in the industry
data-analytics-workshop.description:
We stand today at a place of battle, a battle between technology and development, one that began 40 years ago and still a continuous one.
It’s 2020 and the prime soldiers are IoT, Machine Learning, VR, Cognitive Technology and the chief among them Data Science.
Holding the battlefield together and enhancing the growth of modern tech, is what is the trump card. The time is in dire need of it to move into the forward lines battling across foes and emerging successful.
Why Data Science, is a pondering question amongst even our most budding minds. It isn’t the chief for nothing….
Data is the unit cell of the development of our current world into the Star Trek Visionary of tomorrow. Robots need training data, an AI machine data, a VR needs data to analyze surrounding. Data this and Data that. Data Science is the ace that you need to win the prolonging war. The epitome of expansion beyond the visible horizon, the modern-day trappings of success – DATA SCIENCE.
INTERESTED??? WANNA KNOW MORE ??!!
To enlighten your minds, in lieu of Invente4.0 , SSN in collaboration with Hexaware Technologies , giants in the field of data science after conquering several wars and still the chieftain amongst its competitors,  is staging a talk on “Who wants to be a Data Scientist ? “, by the firm’s lead on Data Science practices who has been involved in several of the aiding sectors such as SPC, ML, AI, Data Analytics etc..

mindhunter.description: Mind Hunter is basically a non technical event which focuses on the inner child of you. Various games like lemon in the spoon , musical chair were our childhood favourite. Mind Hunter is one such nostalgic series of games. We have exciting prizes for the teams as well :)

paper-presentation.tagline: Let your mind write the paper not your hand
paper-presentation.description:
The stage is up and ready to take your novel, ground-breaking ideas in this edition's Paper 
Presentation event, because it's understood that the world's best ideas are birthed not due 
to the invention of them, but more so their sharing.
Topics include:
• Waste water
• Environmental Engineering
• Material Technology
• Nanotechnology
• Process Optimisation
• Biochemical and Biotechnology
• Fuels and Petrochemicals
• Separation
paper-presentation.general_rules:
• Maximum of 3 members per team
• World limit of abstract: 200
• Presentation time: 5-6 minutes
• Email the abstract to: pp2019invente4.0@gmail.com with the file name as the title 
of the paper and subject of the mail as "Paper Presentation - {Participants' names}"
• Judge's decision is final
rounds:
• Maximum of 3 members per team
• World limit of abstract: 200
• Presentation time: 5-6 minutes
• Judge's decision is final

pin_it_up.venue: Fluid Mechanics Laboratory, Department of Chemical Engineering.
pin_it_up.description:
Hit the metaphorical bull's eye with our poster presentation event Pin It Up because if there were to only be two truths in this world, they are these:
Creativity is imaginative intelligence having fun and,
Design isn't some button on the Photoshop software but the turning of the gears in your brain to make the bells in them ding.
Teams with members of 3 will be given the chance to illuminate their research work with a dash of aesthete in the form of a poster which will be tested based on novelty in project and creativity in presentation. So surprise us with creative and constructive posters and we’ll return you with exciting cash prizes!
pin_it_up.general_rules:
• Maximum 3 members per team
• Minimum size of the poster:A2 
•Email your abstracts to: posterpresentationinvente@gmail.com
• Abstract should be not less than 100 words and must not exceed 200 words.
• The file name should be the title of your paper.
• The subject of the mail should be ‘ POSTER PRESENTATION –Registration ‘
• The first page of abstract should contain the Title of the paper, Author’s name and institution’s name.
• A Display board of size 75*60 cm2 will be provided. The poster and the materials that are required to fix the poster (tapes, Clips, etc.) are expected to be brought by the participants. No material other than the display board will be provided for the presentation.
rounds: Venue : Fluid Mechanics Laboratory, Department of Chemical Engineering.

Two judges will be viewing your poster. You’ll be given 6-7 minutes for presenting followed by 2-3 minutes of Q&A session. The selection criteria will be based on novelty in project, way of presenting, scope of project and creativity in poster design. The top three posters will be chosen and awarded with exciting cash awards!

chem-connextions.tagline: Do you get the big picture.....?
chem-connextions.description: As a rendition of the popular Vijay TV show, this event will throw puzzles that revolve around Chemical Engineering at you for you to string together to create the perfect piece of metaphorical cloth! As the old saying goes: as the going gets tough, the tough get going - in the same vein, questions get progressively harder to test your true prowess in your knowledge of the technical world and your ability to connect the dots to make a tantalizing picture in the end.
chem-connextions.general_rules:
1. Maximum team size is 3 people in a team.
2. Use of mobile phone during the event is strictly not allowed.
3. Participants should carry a pen or a pencil. They will be provided with A4 sheet for rough work.
4. Decision of the event heads will be final.
rounds:
1. Prelims will be a paper-pen round.
2. This round will consist of puzzles, crosswords and riddles related to chemical engineering and chemistry. 
3. Duration of this round will be 15 minutes.
4. The top 5 team will be selected for the final round.

1. The finals will be conducted in 3 rounds.
2. A series of pictures will be displayed on the screen and the participants are required to find the connection between them.
3. Each question will have a time limit and will carry a certain amount of points.
4. The team scoring the maximum number of points at the end of 3 rounds will be declared as the winners.
5. In case of a tie, a tie breaker round will be conducted.
6. Event heads decision will be final.

shadow_of_truth.description:
Are you someone who gets intrigued by mysteries? Can't get enough of Netflix's Mystery section, perhaps? Shadow of truth is the right place for you!
The event, comprising of two rounds will first have a general aptitude test on Chemical Engineering and Chemistry topics that will act as an eliminator round (just like Sherlock talks to his clients to weed out the ones he does not find sufficiently interesting- oops, no offense..) and the second round will contain the dirty work - the studying of the crime scene, talking to suspects, insinuating enthralling theories and much more..
So, channel your inner Sherlock (bring a John Watson if you need him, of course), bring a maximum of a couple friends and solve these inimical crimes, crime scene- Chemical Engineering. Awaken your adept engineering minds to decipher the mystery!
shadow_of_truth.general_rules:
1. Maximum team size is 3 members in a team.
2. This event will consist of 2 rounds - prelims and final. Top teams from the prelims will advance to the final round.
2. Use of mobile phone during the event is strictly not allowed.
3. Required stationary must be bought. However, A4 sheet can be provided for rough work, if required.
4. Decision of the event heads will be final.
rounds:
1. Prelims will be a paper-pen round.
2. Duration of the test will be 20 minutes.
3. This round will consist of puzzles on math, crime related puzzles, aptitude and on any broad subject.
4. Top teams will progress to the final round.
5. Decision of the event heads will be final.

1. The final round will consist of 2 levels.
2. The 1st level will consist of a set of problems that will provide a clue.
3. The 2nd level will again consist of puzzles, which can be solved from the clue obtained in the 1st level.
4. The team which solves most number of problems correctly and in the least time will be declared the winner.
5. Decision of the event head will be final.

breaking_bad.description: Breaking bad is a one of a kind technical treasure hunt. Riddles to decode, clues to identify, deduction by knowledge along with a race against others makes it a marathon for your mind while sprinting to the X. Break out for huntin and feel alive.
rounds: General pen and paper quiz. Basic knowledge of chemistry and chemical engineering would suffice. The test will have 20 questions to be answered in 25 minutes. Top 6 teams move on to the final round - The treasure hunt.
Venue : Chemical Engineering department-Technical Analysis Lab

The treasure hunt starts with each team having different clues each leading to different places to reach the next clue. Decoding all clues will lead to the final place X. Top teams will be decided on a combination of speed and accuracy. The winners get ₹2000 ,the runner up gets ₹1500 and the third place gets ₹1000.

stranger_things.tagline: *Find the odd one out because you can be the outstanding one*
stranger_things.description:
This new event demands 
its participants to use their (pseudo)psychokinesis abilities and channelize their inner Eleven 
to solve the mystery of the stranger thing amongst a set of seemingly normal pictures, all of 
which revolve around Chemical Engineering (don't worry, there's a bounty on its head, and a 
huge one at that!). So, Slurpee up and maybe emerge from a mysterious laboratory to win some exciting prizes!!
rounds:
You'll be required to find the odd concept out of the given pictures , equations, etc.
The team which gets the most number of answers right will proceed to the final.

house_of_cards.description:
A chemical engineering pictionary!
Enough said. 
One of the most famous party games for all ages, this chemical engineering pictionary is sure to elicit laughter and imagination alike.  Participate as a team of two/three, try out your drawing skills! 
One participant is required to pick a card from a "house of cards" and make the other guess the chemE technical word written on it  by illustrating it. 
Bring to light the  analytical Mr. Kevin Spacey and win exciting cash prices!
house_of_cards.general_rules:
1. Minimum team size - 2
Maximum team size -3
2. Rules:
 -Each team will be given 30 seconds to guess each word.  
- Players aren't allowed to spell the word letter-by-letter or sound-by sound.
- players aren't allowed to act out the word
rounds: Top 10  teams that guess the maximum number of words right will qualify for the final round.
The team to guess the maximum number of words in 5 minutes wins.

autochem.tagline: Ever wondered what happens when chemical reaction meets formula one?
autochem.description: In our flagship event AUTOCHEM, the participants will be made to build their dream car using their imagination, a bottle, a couple of caps and a chemical reaction that is , as the academic say, 'explosive'. The chemicals will be provided by us and the perfect composition should made by the participants. The car should be made to move within the marked area. This event is full of surprises and a combination of fun elements.
autochem.general_rules:
1) Maxkmum of 3 members per team
2) The stationary for the event will be provided by us

robo-wars.tagline: Champions are made in the ring!
robo-wars.description: Bring your powerful robots ready to battle as you’ll be pitted against other competing robots in one-on-one knockout matches where the aim is to push the opponent’s robot off the arena or immobilizing the other bot and scoring maximum points! Play to your strengths and strategies to win cash prizes!
robo-wars.general_rules:
A team may consist of a maximum of 3 participants. Design and construct a wired or remote controlled bot capable of fighting in a one on one tournament.
General Rules:
The competition will be played on a knock-out basis consisting of 2 players at a time. The maximum duration of each round will be 5 minutes. Any team that is not ready at the time specified will be disqualified from the competition. The machine will be checked for safety before the competition. Any robot found unsafe to other participants and spectators will be disqualified. The organizers reserve the rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit. Change in rules, if any, will be highlighted on the website and notified to the registered teams. Violation of any rule will lead to disqualification. Judges’ decision shall be treated as final and binding on all.
Note: The bot should conform to the specified conditions.
Safety Rules:
Compliance with all event rules is mandatory. It is expected that competitors stay within the rules and procedures of their own accord and do not require constant policing. If you have a robot or weapon design that does not fit within the categories set forth in these rules or is in some way ambiguous or borderline, please contact the event organizers. All weapons must have a safety cover on any sharp edges
Dimensions and Fabrications:
The bot should fit in a 40 cm x 40 cm x 40 cm box with all mechanisms fully executing motions. Length and width is measured to the extremities of the Robot, i.e. includes any overhanging bodywork, weaponry or protrusions. The external device used to control the bot is not included in the size constraint. Maximum weight of the bot should not exceed 10 kgs. (including battery)
Mobility: 
All bots must have easily visible and controlled mobility in order to compete. Movement of robot must be rolling of wheels only. Jumping and hopping is not allowed. Flying (using air foil, helium balloons, ornithopters, etc.) is not allowed
rounds:
Robot Control Requirements:
 If the bot is wired then the wire should remain slack under all circumstances during the competition. All the wires coming out of the bot should be stacked as a single unit. The wires should be properly insulated. Teams are suggested to use only rated wires such as ISI marked. Loose connections or improper wiring may lead to immediate disqualification even before the event. If the bot is controlled wirelessly, the bot must at least have a four-frequency remote control circuit or two dual control circuits which may be interchanged before the start of the race to avoid frequency interference with other teams. The case of any interference in the wireless systems will not be considered for rematch or results. Remote control systems from toys are allowed. Remote control systems available in the market may also be used. Battery and Power: The machine can be powered electrically only. Batteries must be sealed, immobilized- electrolyte types (such as Li-ion, NiCd, NiMH or dry cells). Working voltages must not exceed 24V DC (mean voltage) at any point in time. All power connections must be of an adequate grade and adequately insulated. Cables must be routed to minimize the chances of being cut. All efforts must be made to protect battery terminals from a direct short and causing a battery fire, failure to do so will cause immediate disqualification. Battery Eliminators are allowed and power source would be available at the venue for the eliminators.
Motors:
The robot should move as fast as possible around the arena with the help of motors. DC motors and stepper motors (12V-24V) can be used as per the design of bots. Note: We are not responsible for any damage that your bot may incur during the event.
Score Card: 
The score card is based upon the arena formulation. It is obvious that the robot with an extraordinary dynamism will succeed by thrusting out its combatant from the arena. If a robot is pushed beyond the ring, the round ends and the other team is awarded the points.The first team to win X rounds will get through to the Finals where X will be intimated on the day of the competition. Ultimately, if any of the combatants rolls out from the \arena it will directly be eliminated from the War Field.

Criteria for triumph:
 A robot will be declared immobile if it cannot demonstrate linear motion of at least one inch in a timed period of 30 seconds. A bot with one side of its drive train disabled will not be counted out if it can demonstrate some degree of controlled movement. If both robots survive the 5 minutes, the robot with the higher scorecard points wins. The winner advances to the next round while the loser is eliminated from the tournament.

6.The performance of participants in the GD will be evaluated by the faculty.
7.On a scale of 0 to 1, the weightage for the prelims quiz is 0.5, and the weightage for GD is 0.5.
8.A revised merit list will be drafted after the GD; the top 4 - 6 candidates will be eligible for the Final Interview.
9.The panellists for the interview will be 3 faculty members (one each from the three broad areas of Manufacturing, Design and Thermal).
10.The panellists will unanimously decide the winner and the runners-up based on the performance in the interview.

run-out.description:
Rewind a month back to world cup Semi-final....

"....And they are gonna push for 2, who's gonna cover the keeper's stump....They are gonna go gonnnaaaaaa gooooo, gonna get thereeeeeee, ohhhhhhh direct hittttt... this is the world cupppp... this is Martin Guptill, is this the final ?!?!..."

Then,fast forward to the Final...

"....Goes again, can he get the strike again, this is a big moment... They gotta run, they(NZ) are going to the other end.....ohhhhh he(stokes) gets in the wayyyyy... This is gonna go all the way to the boundary from the bat,can u believe this... It isssss !!!...."

The common factor in both the instances,was Guptil's throw from the boundary....the first instance ,won the game for them...the second instance ,lost it...that is how important a Runout can be in a game of Cricket.

Do you want to go for the run or shoutout a big NO to the non-striker ? 
Completely upto you...decide wisely this Invente...!!!!
run-out.general_rules:
Team Size : 2
Registration Fee : Rs 50 / team
rounds: Venue : ECE dept , Annexure Block , LH -1

Test Type: Pen and Paper Quiz
Test Duration: 15 min
Test Topic : Cricket Related
Test can be taken anytime between 9AM-1PM.
4 Teams with the highest points in the test will qualify for the final round
Venue : ECE Dept , Annexure Block , LH-1

Final Round will consist of 3 matches ( 2 Semifinals and a Final)
 --Each match will consist of 2 innings, where the 2 teams will have to bat as well as field. 
--The two players from the fielding team has to stand near the stumps in the strikers end and non-strikers end and the batting team will run between the wickets while the fielding team tries to answer the quiz and run the batsman out.
--Runs run by the batting team is their score.More time the fielding team takes to finish each round of answers, the more runs the opposite team scores by running between the wickets.
 --Each innings will consist of 6 balls and each ball will consist of 3 questions.
--The total runs run by the batting team is their points.Both the teams switch their roles for their second innings, the batting team tries to chase down the target. 
--the winning team goes to the finals and the same rules are followed in the finals.

Submit your abstracts for the hackaton on or before 03-09-2019. The shortlisted teams will participate in the hackaton on 06-09-2019 at the SSN library. 
The problem statements can be in the domain of IoT , ML , AI , App development.
The shortlisted teams will participate in a 24 hour hackaton from 12PM on 06-09-2019 till 12PM 07-09-2019. 
The judging will be based on product feasibility , scalability and product pitch which will be evaluated by professionals from the industry.
Price  : The top 2 teams will win lucrative price money and internship opportunities.

solder-it.tagline: Ignite your creativity, solder your resolve and find your flair for innovation!
solder-it.description:
Some people accidentally short circuit their electronics, feel the tiny shock of electricity running through them, and run away from their devices. Others thrive on breaking the circuit,
understanding why it happened, and how to fix it. Their dreams are filled with resistors and capacitors forming intricate networks as beautiful as spider webs in the sunlight.
If you belong to this rare breed of dreamers, then you are in for a treat.Come to SOLDER IT@ INVENTE , and you will see the amateur enthusiasts rubbing shoulders with the most formidable professionals at the soldering circuit. Perhaps you will suprise us all!Only time will tell!
solder-it.general_rules:
1. Use of mobile phones and other electronic gadgets is not allowed. Participants will be disqualified for any such use.
2. Judges decision is final.
3. 2-3 members per team. Organisers will help the lone wolves find their pack!
4. Soldering kit and electronic components will be provided.
rounds:
1. The first test will involve the paper and pen test . Participants are required to carry their own accessories. 
2. Calculators are not allowed . 
3. The participants are required to submit the test within the stipulated time. No additional time will be provided. 
4. 8-10 teams will be shortlisted according to the performance for the finals.

1. Participants are requested to be on time to the venue. 
2. The final round will be a soldering round. Timing and perfection plays a major role. 
3.  Soldering set and the electronic components will be provided.
4. Judges decision is final. 
5. Top 3 winners will be awarded with cash prize.

trump_the_aces.description: Learning is a process that continues throughout your life. Attend the event 'Trump the Aces' to know where you stand on the path of learning. This event tests your technical skills along with other soft skills required to thrive in the competitive world. When this is combined with a game of cards, it gives more fun. Pick a card from the deck, try your luck with the ace and find if wisdom can defeat luck. Meet us at 'Trump the Aces' here at INVENTE to reflect on your skill-set and have loads of fun.
trump_the_aces.general_rules: The size of the team can vary between 2 and 3. No prerequisites needed.
rounds: A paper-pen test on various disciplines based on the card chosen. Based on the card chosen, the chances of getting through will vary.

The shortlisted teams will be asked to analyse and critically reflect on solving the problems that is posed based on the card chosen. Some rules will be made known during the event to make it more interesting and fun-oriented. The teams will be given a chance to present their ideas in solving the problems posed at them. Based on the solution and the way of presentation, a winner would be chosen.

triwizard-tournament.venue: EC-1, ECE Annexure block, Ground Floor
triwizard-tournament.tagline: Don't let the muggles get you down!
triwizard-tournament.description:
We are pleasured to announce about our Third Annual Triwizard tournament conducted by the great council of wizards.Come try your patronus charms across our 3 rounds of our tournament and let's see who's the chosen one to own the deathly hallows!!
Experience something like never before at this invente...
#invente 4.0
"Mischief Managed"
triwizard-tournament.general_rules:
1. Teams of 2 or 3 members max are allowed
2. Registration fee of 30 for a team of two and 40 for a team of 3. 
3. Phones should not be used during any round

1. Five words will be given
2. Numbers or letters should not be drawn

1. Rapid fire round
2. Top three will be given prizes

paper-presentation.description:
Paper Presentation is one of the most iconic events in INVENTE 4.0. It is here that students have a great platform to showcase their innovative ideas that could lead to great revolutions in technology.
Teams will have to send their full paper clearly explaining the project idea. Based on the papers sent, teams will get shortlisted to present the paper on the day of the event.
PROJECT DOMAINS:
1. Internet of Things
2. Robotics & Automation
3. Healthcare application
4. Machine Learning and Deep Learning
5. Computer Vision and Image Processing
6. Network and Security Systems
7. Smart City
8. Unmanned Vehicles
9. Green Technology
10. Embedded Systems
Any interesting or innovative idea that does not fall under the mentioned categories above are also welcome.
paper-presentation.tagline: The people who think they are crazy enough to change the things in the world are the ones who do it.
rounds: A team can comprise of a minimum of 1 student and a maximum of 3 students.
The team participants can be from different colleges and from different branches as well.
The paper must be in IEEE format not exceeding 15 pages.
Teams have to send their paper in PDF format to the mail paperpresentation.ece.ssn@gmail.com on or before the stipulated dates with the subject being INVENTE4.0  Paper Presentation.
The body of the mail should contain details of the team members such as participants name, department, college, phone number and e-mail address.
Teams will have to bring full paper on the day of presentation. Each team would be given a time span of 10 minutes to explain their ideas.
The judges decisions shall be binding and final.
Last date for submission of paper: 01.09.2019

ipl-bidding.tagline: Bid it cheap and watch them weep
ipl-bidding.description:
It’s time to recover from WC hangover and get into our IPL madness.
         Who wants to Don the Yellove Jersey?
         Is cricket your Jaan?
         Wanna lift your first cup without choking?
         Let’s don’t mess it up being unpredictable.

         The Lions vs The Paltans.
         Srini Mama vs Ambani.
         And to be honest, RCB vs Ashish Nehra.
         Make your favorite teams win by bidding the right players.
         Be there, participate and win exciting prizes this September.
ipl-bidding.general_rules: Maximum 3 and minimum 1 per team. Using mobiles is strictly forbidden.
rounds:
ONLINE QUIZ: Two teams will be selected for the final round directly from the online quiz. The Online quiz consists of questions from IPL and some important international matches. Participants have to finish the online quiz before the timer ends. 
On the D-day,
         ROUND 1:   Hit it in the crowd.
            Answer the saucy quiz and puzzles and get into the Final round.

FINAL ROUND:     Bid it cheap and watch them weep.
            Bid your favorite players and win the game with a perfect squad.

paper-presentation.tagline: let your mind write the paper and not your hand.
paper-presentation.description: Got exciting and innovative ideas? Here is the best platform to showcase your research ideas in front of experienced faculty members. Unleash the speaker within you and get exciting prizes worth ₹ 9000.
paper-presentation.general_rules:
1. There can be a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 4 candidates per team.

The selected teams will be intimidated through the mail.

The papers will be shortlisted based on Innovative ideas, Plagiarism, Novelty and Style of writing.

TOPICS:

TRACK 2: Electrical machines, Electric traction, Electric vehicles, Special electrical machines, Special motor drives.
TRACK 3: DSP, Embedded systems, Control and Automation, Fuzzy and Neural Networks, Industry4.0, IoT.

The winners will be announced based on novelty, presentation and communication skills and discussion on the paper.
Venue : Ground floor, Seminar Hall, EEE department

project-display.description: Are you looking for a platform to showcase your invention? Do you have a project that is a wonder and will make heads turn in admiration? Then, PROJECT DISPLAY is the right platform for you. This is your opportunity to steal the spotlight and make some good money! Flaunt your project and win exciting prizes.

The project must be within the realm of Electrical and Electronics engineering.

Should have a legitimate title. Titles copied from existing projects will not be allowed.
Must be a working model.
Required components are to be brought by the participants. No components will be provided.

An abstract of around 150 words with an apt project title is to be sent as a pdf attachment to the mail.

ROUND 2:
The working model is to be displayed during Invente 2019.
Each project will be judged by a panel of experienced judges.
The decision of the judges will be final.
Cash prizes worth 6500 up for grabs!

pandora-box.tagline: Unleash the Arduino geek in you
pandora-box.description: Like how the Pandora Box contains the different sins, our box will have different sets of components. Unleash the components within to overcome the gruelling challenges and get rewarded for your innovative ideas.
pandora-box.general_rules:
A team of minimum 1 member and maximum 4 members can participate.
Top 3 teams will be awarded cash prizes. Judges decision is final.

The first round is a pen and paper test consisting of 2 coding logic questions and 15 MCQ type questions based on Arduino.
A maximum time limit of 30 minutes will be provided for each team to complete this round.
The 5 top scoring teams will advance to the final round.
Registration can be done on the spot.
Usage of Internet or calculator is prohibited.

Each team will be given 100 points from which the teams have to choose the components in the box worth the given points.
The teams have to interface the selected components with Arduino and come up with an innovative solution with the least points used.
Maximum time given is 90 minutes.
If any 3 teams out of the 5 manage to come up with solution within the stipulated time, they will be declared winners.

tentkotta.description: Ever come to a technical symposium and wondered where the movie related event is? Then this is the event for you! line-follower.tagline: Follow the line to beat the Clock
line-follower.description: The clock is ticking! Beat the clock to reach the centre. The fastest bot with the smartest algorithm can only follow the time to reach the epicentre and win against the competing bots. Be ready for a race against time at this Invente and win prizes worth Rs. 8000
line-follower.general_rules:
A team may consist maximum of 4 members.
 
Students from different educational institutes can form a team.
 
The line to be traced (black line) is of 30mm in width.

The potential difference between any two points in the bot must not exceed 12V.
 
The bot must be powered only by on-board batteries.
 
The maximum dimensions of the bot should be 20cm x 20cm x 20cm.
 
Ready-made bots are strictly prohibited. (Ready made chassis are allowed)
 
All components should be brought by the participants.
 
Judge's decision will be final and any further arguments with the judges will be penalized.
rounds:
Main objective is to traverse the track as quickly as possible.

Best of 2 tries will be considered.

Participants can adjust their sensors and gains after the first run.

Track will have straight lines, curves, markers,loops, gaps and turns (90 degree, acute and obtuse).

Top 6 teams qualify for the next round.

The track will be a clock.

Main objective is to travel in the clock from the start point to the stop point in the     path which will be specified by the hour and minute hand of the clock.

A team will be given 3 minutes to complete the path. 

Best of 2 tries will be considered.

Track will have straight lines, curves, markers,loops, gaps and turns (90 degree, acute and obtuse).

In case of a tie, winners will be decided based on the time taken to complete the maximum path.

electronic-maze.tagline: "Engage yourself in a Permanent Maze of Possibilities"
electronic-maze.description: Ever watched maze runner movie, or played maze game on a computer? Wanna experience something similar? Discover new paths and win exciting prizes worth 6500!!!

1.Each team must consist at the  most three members.
2. Any sort of electronic gadgets is strictly prohibited.
3. On-spot registration .
rounds:
1.It is basically a pen and paper test. There will  be a total of 25 questions  which you have to solve within a limited time period of 15 minutes,out of which most of them are mcqs. They will test your basics in electrical and electronics.
3.The teams capable of getting maximum possible correct answer will be qualified for the final round.
4. About 6 to 8 teams will be choosen for the final round.
5. Usage of electronic gadgets is prohibited

1. In the final round you will  be given a maze to solve which will lead you to a 🏆
2. Every path in the maze will have a problem which has to be solved in order to move further .You can also choose alternate paths if present.
3. Only three lives will be given .For each wrong answer you will be losing them.
4. The team which is capable of solving most no of questions in a shorter time span will be declared winners.
5.1st and 2nd runner-ups will also be awarded.

d-sim.description: Are you the kind of person who speaks binary? Do you like to play around with logic gates? Are you enlightened by the HIGHs and LOWs of life? Here we are with the best opportunity to fire up your neurons. Fasten your seatbelt 'coz this is gonna be an adventurous ONE
rounds:

Round 1 will be conducted via Google form. The link to the Google form will be shared when the participants arrive at venue. (Computers will be provided, participants can also use their mobiles to access the Google form)
Participants will be qualified to the next round based on their scores and time taken to solve round 1.

This round has three questions which involves design and debugging  of logical circuits and simulating it
1. Design and simulation of solution to the given problem statement 
2. Reduce the given logical expression and validate it using simulation 
3. Debugging the logical circuit with given constraints

tech-quiz.description: At invente 4.0, see if you can win the One Piece ,the treasure left by the king of the pirate. e-vehicles-and-hybrid-vehicles.description:
Its almost 2020! Yes, we aren’t still in the stone age to travel in petrol and diesel engine driven vehicles…the time has come to step up to build a sustainable and renewable future for the forthcoming generations. And the next big thing which is happening in and around us is the “Electric Revolution in the Automobile sector”.  Yes…. An electric revolution in the automobile sector.
Interested? Want to know about it? Here is the best platform to enlighten your minds. Presenting you Toyota Kirloskar Motor and Ather Energy– the automobile giants who are fast accelerating in the market of Hybrid Vehicles and E- Vehicles. 
Toyota and Ather Energy in association with Invente 4.0 is staging a talk on the technological advancements and the technical and industrial aspects required for the field of E-Vehicles and Hybrid Vehicles here in SSN College of Engineering.
Grab your seats, as this is one opportunity where you can directly come across the tycoons in person. 
Get ready to explore the infinity and to explore, be there at the Justice Pratap Singh Auditorium in SSN College of Engineering on the 7th of September 2019.
On spot registrations are also available.

dc-marvel-quiz.description: To the fans of Marvel and DC out there, brimming with the knowledge on comics and cinematic universe; An opportunity to present that expertise is here. Do you know all the characters and their back-stories? If so, then the trivia challenge is for you, give it a shot and see if you deserve the number one fan title.

Answer sheets will be provided.

So be there, to play and relive our childhood 'BOX CRICKET'. (Don't worry, no: of boundaries don't decide the winner here)

rounds:

word-rush.description:
Hey there, It’s time for your brain to train!
If you are interested in word games, then this event is exclusively for you.
This event is going to test your love for word games along with your exposure to technical terms of various engineering disciplines.

2 Only 2-3 participants are allowed in a team.

A question bank with ten different word puzzles will be given to solve.
     	2. Participants will be given 10 mins to solve these questions.

ROUND 2: 
This round consists of three different games,cumulative scores of these games will be taken into consideration for the final round.
Flash cards- It’s a memory game, only one member from each team can participate in this game.
Start music-It’s a musical dumb-C based on different words, two members from each team can participate in this game. 
Club it-It’s a physical task where the participants need to run around and find their words to pair it with their team member’s word, two members
From each team can participate in this game.

ROUND 3: FINAL ROUND
     	1. This round is based on the famous television show – CONNEXIONS.
    	2. Picture clues will be provided and participants should guess theword.
 3. Based on the final score, judges will choose the winner.

staad-pro.description:
Are you a design enthusiast? Do you want to learn to work with the most widely used software in the construction industry for structural design and analysis? Here is a chance for you all to learn STAAD.Pro from the most renowned training institute, “CADD centre , Porur”.

So what if STAAD.Pro isn’t part of the 2017-reg Curriculum? Take advantage of the STAAD.Pro workshop this INVENTE- 4.0 and move a step forward in the process of becoming an industry ready candidate
rounds: Register separately for the workshop by paying Rs.300

music-tiles.description: How many times have song lyrics dominated your minds during the exam hall? Aren’t you the students who get pumped up right from the first second of a song.  Let’s put all those talents into proper use and convince ourselves that the memory you’ve picked up over the years is totally worth it. Come play the moments, pause the memories, stop the mind and rewind the happiness.

Round 2: Naduvula Konjam Pakatha Kaanom
1.	Find the lyrics in between the song.
2.	Winning team will be awarded with  prices.

clash-of-claims.description:
The world out there isn't a silent place, but is shockingly beginning to get a silent crowd around. Enough of staying lost in thoughts, it's time for you to present them and what better place for you to do it than here.  It's time to break the shackles and VOICE- for our technology , for our ecosystems, for us. 
Department of Civil Engineering presents its flagship 'Engineering debate' event, tailormade for those who wish to present their perspectives and talk about matters that matter. This event tests your logical thinking ability, technical knowledge, factual accuracy and spontaneity to answer and counter your opponent's question. It is open for all departments.
clash-of-claims.general_rules:
• Event Type: Both On-spot and Online. 
• Maximum no of persons per team: Two. 
• Cross College teams (except SSN Students teams) are allowed.
rounds:
The format for the Debate in this round is as follows (this will be strictly adhered to):

First for affirmative Speaker:  3 minutes (2 minutes protected time + 1 minute open 
to questioning)
First against affirmative Speaker: 3  minutes
Second for affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Second against affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Final rebuttal rounds (One from each team) : 2.5 minutes (protected time)

* Debate topics will be disclosed 30 minutes before the start of the event to the 
participant teams registering on-spot. 
* Debate topics will be disclosed 1 day before the start of the event to the 
participant teams registering online.

arCADe.venue: CAD Lab, Department of Civil Engineering
arCADe.description:
‘Every existing structure was once a design.’
Be it an ordinary apartment building or an amazing structure, Design decides everything. So, we present you the arCADe, an opportunity to groom your ingenious design skills.

Note: Exciting internship opportunity at Indus instruments.

qureka.description: Quiz competition is a pursuit of trivial Knowledge, encouraging students to achieve academic excellence and Increase their awareness of the technical world around them

Disobeying the rules.

call-of-builders.description:
"Each type of knowledge has value; however, from an engineering point of view, practical knowledge seems to be more valuable than theoretical knowledge."
	Engineering is the art of modelling materials that have never been made and creating things that has never been thought of in the first place.It’s time for the engineer within you to venture out in the numerous possibilities this field offers!  INVENTE 4.0 offers you a platform to express  your creative thinking , so come & join us at ‘CALL OF BUILDERS’

eventHeads.name: HEMA NAGA SRI PUSHPA SWETHA T

The structure should be made within the given materials as no extra materials will be provided. The structure will be tested for loading capacity. The structure which holds more load will be declared as winner.

soltiare.description: Hey there, are you concerned about the many crises the world faces and do you have a solution for those crises? Here is “SOLVE-IT-aire”! - An event being launched at the INVENTE 4.0. This event is a platform for all the genius to showcase their quick-wit and problem solving skills. SOLVE-IT-aire promises to serve as a testimonial for your talent!

RULES:
1.	The event consists of three rounds.
2.	Only 2 participants are allowed in a team.
3.	Students must carry their college id-card.

2.	Participants are given 60 sec to find 5 words.
3.     One of the participant (who knows the word) should give hint to the other participant of his/her team. Only one hint at a time should be given and the hint should be only one word.

1.	One member from the team should draw the given word and the other member should guess the word.
2.	Cumulative scores of both the rounds will be taken into consideration for the final round.

2.	 4-5 minutes will be given to the participant to arrive at a solution for the given problem.
3.	Economical and practical solutions are considered.
4.	Judges will finalize the best solution.

paper-presentation.description:
“Every once in a while a new technology, an old problem and a big idea turn into an innovation.”
Believe it or not ! Presentation unleashes Innovation and ignites Inspiration ‘cause until and unless an idea is tested or questioned, it can’t be approved or be accepted as an Innovation. We are offering you a forum to showcase your presentation skills and in-depth knowledge of your research area in which your work will be weighed and evaluated by seasoned academic professionals.

Topic :  
Any topic related to Civil Engineering is welcome. Preferably, “Recent Advances in Civil Engineering” 

Note :
1.Chance to win The Best Innovation Award & The Best Presenter Award apart from the 1st, 2nd and 3rd prizes.
2.The Paper winning the first place will directly be selected for National Level Conference held at SSN College of Engineering.

4.Selected participants must bring their college ID cards.

Paper Format :

1.Paper should be in Microsoft Word Format or PDF Format.
2.It should be written in Single Column format using "Times New Roman" Font with font size as "12".
3.Keep the layout of the text as simple as possible.
4.Equations and formulae should be legible, preferably written using equation.
5.The affiliations of the author and co-author should be enclosed in the title page of the abstract.
rounds:
1.An abstract (150 to 300 words) of the topic is to be sent to the organising team through mail [ paper4invente@gmail.com ] on or before 30th August, 2019 (11:59 PM).
2.The Selection Criteria will be based on the Uniqueness of the topic.
3.After selection, the participant(s) should mail [ paper4invente@gmail.com ] the camera-ready paper to the organising team on or before 3rd September, 2019 (11:59 PM).

1.The selected participants should report at the venue on 7th September 2019, with camera-ready paper (Hard copy) and a presentation (PPT) in a pen drive at 9:30 am as the event will begin at 10 am.
2.The duration provided to each team will be 10 minutes (7 mins for presentation and 3 mins for panel discussion). Presentation is to be prepared accordingly.
3.Participants will be judged on their creativity, presentation skills and format.
4.The Judging Panel's decision will be considered final.

quote-or-quit.description:
Estimation for a project is no child's play, but we have the most simplified version for all you beginners out there! Attention to all you bidders, Department of Civil Engineering provides you with a live arena to learn, realize and reflect some important lessons in construction estimation. So be seated in the most important chair of a construction firm, and make the best use of your street-smartness and analytics


Note: Exciting internships opportunities will be given for the winners
quote-or-quit.general_rules:
1. Participants can form a group of maximum 2 people. Individual participation is also encouraged
2. Use of mobile phone is prohibited
rounds: In this round the basic concepts of civil engineering pertaining to estimation will be tested.A total of 15 questions will be asked and team which gets the maximum score will be qualified for the next round
In this round, a building plan accompanied by set of tasks will be given. The closest estimate will be awarded based on set of criteria.

pcb-workshop.venue: Medical Software Lab, 1st floor, Biomedical Department
pcb-workshop.tagline: Simulate it before you even see it
pcb-workshop.description: Do you feel that taking your projects from the breadboard to something more permanent is tough? Do you struggle with designing your PCB in a neat manner? Have never designed a PCB virtually? Then this workshop on designing  PCBs using the recent and high rated software is just what you need! Department of Biomedical Engineering &  IEEE EMBS is offering you this chance to transform how you design a PCB through this one-day workshop.
pcb-workshop.general_rules:
Prior knowledge:
Basic knowledge of electrical engineering is sufficient, no programming knowledge is required.

Tools Provided (for the session): 
Reference Materials, PCB Fabrication Materials
Concepts: 
Circuit Designing, Simulation, PCB Design Structure, Component Placement and Design, Testing, Board Analysis, Fabrication output generation.

Projects: -
Create a desired Printed circuit board structure      
Design, Testing and Analysis of Electronic circuit board     


Agenda: 
Session 1- Computerized capture of electronic designs
Session 2- Introduction to PCB Layout & Library creation

Important points:
Fee: Rs. 250/- per head.
Computer systems will be provided with software pre-installed.
rounds: Venue : Medical Software Lab, 1st floor, Biomedical Department
Registration is required prior to participation ( Online as well as Onspot)

biogonize.venue: BME department second year class room(Ground floor)
biogonize.tagline: It's not just your brains that need to work.
biogonize.description: Are the conventional quizzes,  circuits and so on bore you ? If you are someone who wishes to use both parts of your brain then Biogonize is surely your get away.The third version of Biogonize is a fun filled event where students from all departments get the taste of simple biology around them .Make sure you pack yourselves with your Engineering memory ,story telling and artistic skills with a brush on your technical aspects as well.
biogonize.general_rules:
1.per team 3 members 
2.insight on different Engineering concepts and knowledge about devices in hospitals.
rounds: Venue : BME department second year class room(Ground floor)

Round 1: Threadripper 
A 30 second long video with around 20 pictures related to the  Engineering and technology will he played to a team of 3 .Top 10 teams who guess the most number of images will be into the next round .
Venue : Bme second year class room(Ground floor)

Parallel Universe 
The teams will be given 5 words related to biomedical engineering and hospitals .The  top 5 teams that comes with the most interesting  and relevant stories will be selected for the final round  .
Each team will be given 5 minutes to prepare a 6 minute long story.
Venue : Bme second year class room(Ground floor)

Round 3 : Cloning 
Making models on the given theme with the materials they buy from the market in there will be the task.Coins to buy the materials will be provided by us .
2 hours will be given to make the model. 
Two teams will be given prizes based on the best model in terms of creativity and relatability to the real ones  .
Cash prize 
Winners 2500
Runners 1000

multiverse.description:
Are you one of the casual gamer? Come  explore the fun side inside you....Come grab exciting cash prizes for bringing out the best in you..
Be prepared to get the feel of a carnival...
A breather fun event amidst the hectic technical presentations and competitions...
rounds: Expect carnival like games, where you can register multiple times and win prizes worth way more than what you spend

gizmo-wizard.tagline: Constitute crazy contraptions and satiate your intellectual desires
gizmo-wizard.description:
A contraption is what you have to build, a series of simple, linked mechanisms, resembling the 'domino effect', once started will end only with the achievement of your task.
So put your thinking caps on because Gizmo Wizard will challenge your science knowledge and your creativity at once, to declare the true 'Wizards'.
gizmo-wizard.general_rules:
Team size: 3-4 members.
Things to he bought by attendees:
1.Gears, wheels,Axle,belts,pulleys,motors
2. Basic items like dominoes, tape, straws, balls, etc.
(Anything of your choice).
3. Marbles, slinky, pull back toys, wooden blocks.
4. Foil, thread, clothespin , rubber bands, shoelaces.
5. Hot wheels, books, cups, pipes, cardboards.
rounds:
1. Have a series of mechanisms, each linked to the next, from
start to finish.
2. Operate completely on its own, once started.
3. Fit into the area allocated base, other than any components
designated to trigger another contraption. There is no limit to the
height of your subsystem, but it must be free-standing.
4. Have 4 or more simple machines (the simpler the machines,
the better).
5. Not involve any living things (other than a person to start it).
6. Be safe (it should not contain potentially hazardous items or
operate in a hazardous way).
7. Not damage other contraptions.

Evaluation Criteria:

• The machine should fit the design brief.

• The machine should complete its task with no human
intervention.
• The machine should be reliable.
•m
• The machine’s steps should be innovative.
• Materials/Components should be used in unique ways.

• Contraption should have at least 4 steps using at least 4
different simple machines.
• Five points will be awarded for each additional step beyond 4
• All steps should be unique

• Team members must actively participate throughout

• Mechanical advantage should be calculated for at least 2
of the simple machines in the contraption.

Total prize money:6000

biomart.venue: Seminar Hall, Ground Floor, Department of Biomedical Engineering
biomart.tagline: Bid and keep your stakes high while establishing your very own Hospital!
biomart.description: The right event for the Business minds out there! All that you have to do is keep your stakes high, and at the same time procure all the necessary equipment to establish your hospital! Don’t forget to Tweak every detail! The Novelty of your plan along with the presence of mind to deal with spurious accidents and cases, will definitely take you places! Become an aspiring Manager, and a successful Planner all at the same time!  Exciting goodies await the Winners! You sure don’t want to miss this!

● By the end of the second round, only the top 5 teams with higher number of bucks will be selected for the final showdown!
Venue : Seminar Hall, Ground Floor, Department of Biomedical Engineering

● Final showdown is fun and frolic! Your stakes might taste profit or might meet accident. It all depends on how well you manage shares and hoe artistic is your design in terms of planning. Present to us your Business model and Value proportion, the team whose model is the best, will be the ultimate business-o-crats!!

paper-presentation.description: Whatever we may create in this world, having it to be used directly to save a man's life is always special.We provide you a platform here to present all those ideas which you beleive would create a difference in this world. The best saves win cash prize of over 5.5K .So be creative and innovative as much as you can.

Plagiarism is strictly not encouraged and participants will be disqualified if they are found plagiarising ideas.
rounds: Venue : Diagnostic and therapeutic lab-second floor ( BME dept)

The following are the domains for paper presentation:
Healthcare technology
Nano electronics
Biosignal processing
Artificial organs
Physiological modelling
Digital image processing
Artificial neural networks
VLSI signal processing
Real time embedded systems
Robotics

Abstract has to be submitted(word document)in not more than 300 words before the due date (2nd September 2019) to the mail id : papersbme4.0@gmail.com

Based on peer review of the abstracts, contestants will be shortlisted for the next round. 

If chosen, the hard copy of the paper with the abstract in A4 sheets(not more than 10 pages including references,tables and graphs) has to be submitted on the day of the event. The paper should be in IEEE format and written in Times New Roman font.

The ‘Microsoft Powerpoint’ presentation should be mailed to the organizing team on or before the 6th of September and can last for a maximum of 7 minutes. There will be a 3 minute Q&A session following it.

game-over.description:
This is not just any game. The gamers have to out skill the other teams to be able to go to the finals! Play the prelims, win the points, hide your flags and tag other lads! 
Come and experience a game of arcade and laser tag! Prize Money upto 4k per team! "Its Game over Baby!" #PurinjavanPistaa
game-over.general_rules:
Teams of 5, Entry fee of 20/- per head. Simply follow these three rules :
1. Stick to your team
2. Bring shoes 
3. No violence
rounds:
Prelims is full on Arcade, initially points will be given, use the points to play the games. Over winning a game, points will be added. Keep playing, use points to earn more. Teams will be shortlisted based on maximum games played and points earned. 4 teams will go to the finals, a game of capture the flag and laser tag. 
Points cannot be bought, only earned.
*Takes place on both the days

2 teams will compete, each team is given a flag. Protect it form the other team and capture theirs! Solely based on teamwork. Obstacles will be present. Violence of any sort will not be encouraged. Shoes are mandatory and the team to capture opponent's flag first will be deemed winner! 
*Takes place on both the days
